wikitext.*:
{{quote|But these creatures of [[Isengard]], these [[half-orcs]] and goblin-men that the foul craft of [[Saruman]] has bred, they will not quail at the [[sun]].|[[Gamling]]<ref name=Deep>{{TT|Deep}}, p. 536</ref>}}
[[File:Jan Pospíšil - Goblin Man.jpeg|thumb|200px|right|"Goblin Man" by [[:Category:Images by Jan Pospíšil|Jan Pospíšil]]]]
'''Goblin-men''' were a people or race of creatures that were bred by [[Saruman]] in the late [[Third Age]]. They were similar to the [[Half-orcs]], at least in their resistance to sunlight, an attribute that differentiated them from the full [[Orcs]].
[[File:Decipher - Goblin Man.jpg|thumb|200px|right|Goblin Man - ''[[The Lord of the Rings Trading Card Game]]'']]
The exact difference between Goblin-men and Half-orcs was unclear, but [[Gamling]], a man of [[Rohan]], mentioned both of them during the [[Battle of the Hornburg]] as creatures of [[Isengard]] that the foul craft of Saruman had bred when he observed that they did not shy back from the sun. Goblin-men fought alongside Orcs (including the [[Uruk-hai]]), Half-orcs, and [[Dunlendings]] in the Battle of the Hornburg.<ref name=Deep/>

In the [[Third Age]] Saruman interbred [[Orcs]] and [[Men]] and produced Orc-men and Men-orcs.<ref>{{MR|P5X}}, pp. 418-9</ref> It is possible that Goblin-men and Orc-men were the same creatures, since the word 'Goblin' was used as a translation of the [[Westron]] word 'Orc'.<ref>{{H|Preface}}</ref> At the [[First Battle of the Fords of Isen]], an Orc-man slew prince [[Théodred]], the son and heir of [[Théoden|King Théoden]] of [[Rohan]], before himself being slain by [[Grimbold]].<ref>{{UT|Isen}}</ref>
